programme.desc: Kryten discovers his expiry date is less than 24 hours away, prompting Lister and Rimmer to organise a party he will never forget, but when the mechanoid decides to avoid being shut down he does not realise his actions could cost the rest of the crew their lives. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: More thrills, spills, customer carts and crashes in this extreme downhill battle at the Eduardo VII Park in Lisbon.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: In the Jebel Akhdar mountain range of Oman, Steve leads an expedition into an unexplored desert canyon. With temperatures soaring, dehydration and heat stroke are a constant threat.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Colin Lane and Desiree Burch join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer host Sandi Toksvig's questions on the theme 'Overseas', in an extended edition of the unorthodox quiz. During the course of the show, the panellists find out about Allotment Annies as well as who keeps their brothers in a cage. The fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers the questionmaster considers most interesting, though not necessarily correct.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Reginald D Hunter and playwright Lucy Prebble joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the quiz with a difference, with guests Matt Lucas, Lucy Porter and Ross Noble joining regular panellist Alan Davies, focusing on medical matters.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Nish Kumar, Luisa Omielan, David O'Doherty
programme.desc: Last week saw the return of the comedy show in which three comedians take the stage of the Hammersmith Apollo in west London. The premise is simple. One comic acts as host, warming up the audience before introducing short sets by two other stand-ups. Future editions promise the likes of Ed Byrne, Rob Beckett, Joel Dommett, Henning Wehn, Lucy Porter, but tonight Nish Kumar plays host, before handing over to David O'Doherty and Luisa Omielan.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of with the help of guests Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Tiff Stevenson. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer tries desperately to earn a commission and qualify for transfer from Red Dwarf to an advanced holoship containing the cream of the Space Corps, and a woman he has developed feelings for. Starring Chris Barrie and Craig Charles.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: A mechanical life form named the Inquisitor's quest to eliminate worthless beings brings him aboard Red Dwarf, where he has plenty of candidates to choose from. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: An alternative USA where technology is banned spells trouble for Rimmer and Kryten, and the Dwarfers infiltrate the tech-savvy underground to try to bring down the regime. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Late Nite Eats
programme.desc: Chef Jordan Andino is on the hunt to find restaurants that reign supreme in the late-night food scene, meeting other chefs to taste their most popular dishes.

programme.title: Late Nite Eats
programme.desc: Jordan Andino visits Tucson, where chef Ramiro spends the day roasting a whole pig. His late night best seller is the Pasco Nachos, loaded with cheesy sauce and juicy pork.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank take picking to a whole new level when they come across people who are not afraid to go big when it comes to collecting.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders head to Blackpool Pleasure Beach, where Nat and John gamble on a mode of transport, and an unpopular bargain hunter returns to the group.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: In Oxford, John goes against his wife's advice and ends up in a conflict with Dan, while Linda thinks she has spotted something the other bidders are yet to see, and George and Rupert take a risk on mysterious items hidden under dust sheets. Presented by Sean Kelly.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Houston, Eddie faces the 'grim reaper' in a crawfish challenge featuring the fearsome reaper pepper. He also devours some southern comfort food and pulls a plane down a runway.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Strongman Eddie meets - and eats - gators roaming the Everglades, tests his grappling skills with WWE legends The Headbangers, and tries to devour a kitchen sink full of ice-cream.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team takes the BMW M3, Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG and Audi RS4 to Spain for a thorough test of performance. David Tennant is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, James May drives a Jaguar XF and Richard Hammond wonders what happened to that ultimate symbol of 1960s grooviness - the beach buggy.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Dozens of amateur racers hurtle through the Chilean capital of Santiago, with only gravity propelling their wacky homemade vehicles.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Kia Cee'd through a rigorous but peculiar road test featuring eels, curry, a rock legend, an American police officer and an unusual game of rugby involving James May. Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the Mastretta MXT, but worries about the repercussions of a comment he made in a previous episode about Mexico, the sports car's country of manufacture. Plus, three high-performance hatchbacks are driven with gusto around the test track, and Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton gets a second chance to smash the lap record.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters square up to their Australian counterparts in an automotive version of the Ashes, with challenges including rallying, drifting and a double-decker car race. Jeremy Clarkson also test-drives the Ferrari 599 GTO, and Boris Becker gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an edition first broadcast in 2007, Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May celebrate British Leyland's 40th birthday by trying to boost the reputation of the cars that once rolled off its production line. The Aston Martin DBS is put through its paces on the test track, Jennifer Saunders is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car and the team asks whatever happened to the beach buggy.

programme.title: Taskmaster

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Outnumbered star Hugh Dennis, presenter Ben Fogle, newsreader Kate Silverton and Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood are this week's guests on the comedy panel show. programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

Starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer finally tires of being embarrassed by his fellow crewmen, and decides to take his revenge by forcing them to spend 12 weeks in strict quarantine after they are exposed to a deadly virus. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Live at the Apollo Christmas Special
programme.desc: The BAFTA nominated comedy showcase returns for its third annual Christmas special, welcoming some of the biggest and best comedic talent to the stage for some Yuletide frolics. Previous editions have featured stand-up routines and compering from renowned comedians such as Ed Byrne, Nish Kumar, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Henning Wehn. This time, Canadian comedian, writer and actress Katherine Ryan hosts the show, welcoming former I'm A Celebrity contestant and stand-up comic Joel Dommett, and Bristol-born comedian and radio presenter John Robins to the stage.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of unseen material from this series of the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon. programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister has his kidneys removed following an altercation with a deranged droid and the only solution is to ask Cat, the most selfish creature in the universe, to give him one of his. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer finally tires of being embarrassed by his fellow crewmen, and decides to take his revenge by forcing them to spend 12 weeks in strict quarantine after they are exposed to a deadly virus. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles and Chris Barrie.

programme.desc: Tim and Gendle are inspired by a game of Top Golf, though they replace balls with bikes, and take the action to a lake littered with targets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slade's resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Maurice Denham.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Featuring a look at sightings of UFOs during the Second World War, a US plan to use bats against Japan's cities, and a German attempt to persuade British POWs to change sides.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett travels from Britain to Jerusalem via Sicily, examining the expansion and unchecked ambition of the Norman empire, and how its impact still resonates in today's culture and politics. He discovers how, under the leadership of Scandinavian raider Rollo, these descendants of the Vikings first established themselves in northern France and became an unstoppable force of Christian knights and warriors.

He discovers how, under the leadership of Scandinavian raider Rollo, these descendants of the Vikings first established themselves in northern France and became an unstoppable force of Christian knights and warriors.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett examines the impact of the conquest of Britain and Ireland, and learns how William the Conqueror built scores of castles and cathedrals to impose his control and intimidate the population. The ruler also commissioned the Domesday Book to survey the wealth of the land and raise revenue, and set in motion the linguistic and cultural transformation of England. The Normans blended well in Scotland, but faced fierce opposition in Wales, and promoted divisions in Ireland which some claim still exist to this day.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Scottish serial killer Peter Manuel, who murdered at least eight people between 1956 and 1958 in the Greater Glasgow area.

programme.title: The Day They Dropped the Bomb
programme.desc: Documentary marking the 70th anniversary of the day the world's first atomic bomb was detonated above the Japanese city of Hiroshima on August 6, 1945. Featuring a minute-by-minute account of what happened on that tragic day, through archive footage and interviews with eyewitnesses who rarely speak about their experience of the bombing. Also interviewed is navigator Theodore Van Kirk, who was the last surviving member of the crew who dropped the bomb, before his death in 2014.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Featuring a look at sightings of UFOs during the Second World War, a US plan to use bats against Japan's cities, and a German attempt to persuade British POWs to change sides.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: Documentary looking at railroads constructed during history's most turbulent periods, now associated with some of mankind's ugliest deeds. Beginning with the Trans-Pyrenees Railway.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels down the west of Scotland, through the mountainous terrain of Arran toward the English border at Gretna. En route they pass Prestwick Airport, the impressive mudflats of Solway Firth, and the Ardeer dunes, where 19th-century inventor Alfred Nobel built what was then the world's largest explosives factory. Neil Oliver presents.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: The search for traces of British warship HMS Curacoa, which collided with the Queen Mary and sank 50 miles off the Irish coast in 1942. The vessel was escorting the liner, which was carrying 20,000 American troops, to the Clyde when the accident occurred, though a news blackout subsequently obscured details of the incident.

programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: An exploration of the Harz Mountain Railway in Germany - Europe's longest rail network - which still uses steam locomotives and has a murky, hidden past.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: The use of propaganda in Hitler's Nazi regime. The first episode examines the Fuehrer's fascination with propaganda, which began in the trenches of the First World War.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The search for looted gold hidden by the Nazis in North Africa. Plus, how the Russian army used dogs as a secret weapon and a mysterious message just before the Pearl Harbor attack.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Ruins from the time before the fall of the Berlin Wall, including a covert Communist base that hid Cold War submarines for Tito and the former HQ of the Soviet Army in East Germany.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A new building changing the iconic Manhattan skyline, which engineers believe will be the most slender skyscraper ever built, as they push the boundaries in skyscraper construction.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett examines the Normans' expansion toward southern Europe and the Middle East in the 11th century. Southern Italy and Sicily were conquered and a prosperous kingdom flourished on the island, which became an important centre of medieval culture and an example of harmony between religions. However, Pope Urban II's call for holy war against the Muslims, to win Jerusalem back, led to the Normans embarking on the First Crusade.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Historian Stephen Baxter explores his own theory that the Domesday Book was commissioned to confer revolutionary powers on the monarchy in the 11th century, and not intended as a means to collect taxes. He examines how the first great national survey, which recorded who owned every piece of land and property in England, was a massive logistical exercise that documented the traumatic impact of the Norman Conquest.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Dramatised account of 19th-century serial killer Mary Ann Cotton, aka the Black Widow, who travelled around the north east of England, and murdered men for the life insurance.

programme.desc: Neil Oliver leads the team to Cornwall and discovers the network of communication cables under Porthcurno beach. Miranda Krestovnikoff discovers how a shipwreck can be turned into a natural wildlife sanctuary, and Mark Horton visits the Isles of Scilly - known to some archaeologists as the Isles of the Dead.

programme.title: The True Story of the Mary Celeste
programme.desc: On December 4, 1872, the Mary Celeste was found adrift in the Atlantic with its cargo fully intact, yet with no one on board. Experts use CGI and fresh evidence in a bid to solve the mystery of the ship and learn how and why its crew disappeared.

programme.desc: A group of amateur pilots find their light plane has a glorious war record - and launch an ambitious project to rebuild the Piper Cub and restore its military markings.

programme.desc: The story of Major General Roy Urquhart, who successfully evaded the enemy in his retreat across the Rhine after leading British troops into a doomed attack at Arnhem.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The case of Dr Ruxton, a physician who lived a quiet, respectable life in Lancaster, until in 1935 he beat, strangled and stabbed his wife and housemaid to death.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels from Dover to the Isle of Wight. Geographer Nicholas Crane hangs off the cliffs near Beachy Head, East Sussex, to discover how the chalk coastline was formed and historian Neil Oliver investigates why the Victorian Channel Tunnel was started more than 120 years ago but never finished. Meanwhile, anthropologist Alice Roberts visits the Isle of Wight, where she meets the men who helped launch Britain's first satellite.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The murder in 1943 of businessman Sir Harry Oakes in the Bahamas, where the Duke of Windsor was governor at the time, and implicated in influencing the outcome of his murder trial.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek dives into the lost Jowett marque, as a Bradford-built 1952 Javelin finds an unexpected home. Paul and Dave uncover a Ford Escort that's been untouched for 30 years.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of the African deserts, where rain may not fall for 10 years at a time. In spite of inhospitable conditions, a multitude of species survives in these arid landscapes, including cartwheeling spiders, camels, squirrels which use their tails as sunshades, and even crocodiles.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Fergal Keane narrates a documentary focusing on the abundant wildlife found along the continent's 29,000km coastline. Species exist in habitats as diverse as the icy waters of the Cape and the tropical climes of the Indian Ocean, leading to some bizarre variations in behaviour - seals eat birds and die of heatstroke, crabs climb trees and penguins live in deserts.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of guitarists taken from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Includes electric performances by Carlos Santana, Mark Knopfler, Peter Green and the Edge, and acoustic material by John Martyn, John Renbourn, Bert Jansch and Paco Pena.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of 1970s-era axe-men, acoustic virtuosos and thumping riff merchants, in a compilation of guitar-heavy performances from the BBC TV archives. Guitar gods including Jimi Hendrix, Pete Townshend, Peter Green and Johnny Winter are joined by, among others, flamenco maestro Manitas De Plata, bottleneck bluesman Ry Cooder and straight-up rockers AC/DC and Thin Lizzy. Plus, Fleetwood Mac, the Jam and Be Bop Deluxe and Nils Lofgren.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels from Bangkok in Thailand to Mandalay in Myanmar, tracing the route of the notorious Burma-Siam Railway. The 250-mile line was built by the Japanese during the Second World War using enslaved Asian workers and Allied PoWs, and Chris visits the famous site of the Bridge on the River Kwai along the way.

programme.title: Titanic: Stories from the Deep
programme.desc: Thanks to the use of cutting-edge technology, a unique collection of artefacts salvaged from the underwater resting site of the famous wreck suggest new stories of love, deception, fate and heroics. This first episode touches on Fifth Officer Harold Lowe. After Titanic sank, his lifeboat was one of the few to go back and pick up survivors. One of the people he saved, Renee Harris, gifted him a set of gold-plated nautical equipment as a symbol of her gratitude. Plus, a well-preserved alligator bag recovered from the wreck site containing fascinating clues about the life of its owner.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A new building changing the iconic Manhattan skyline, which engineers believe will be the most slender skyscraper ever built, as they push the boundaries in skyscraper construction.

Nick Crane investigates beach pebbles, and Neil Oliver looks around a mysterious cave on the Great Orme.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels down the west of Scotland, through the mountainous terrain of Arran toward the English border at Gretna. En route they pass Prestwick Airport, the impressive mudflats of Solway Firth, and the Ardeer dunes, where 19th-century inventor Alfred Nobel built what was then the world's largest explosives factory. Neil Oliver presents.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Unexplained events during wartime, including German submarines that discovered previously unknown sea creatures and a Japanese bomb that floated on the jet stream.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Featuring a look at sightings of UFOs during the Second World War, a US plan to use bats against Japan's cities, and a German attempt to persuade British POWs to change sides.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The search for looted gold hidden by the Nazis in North Africa. Plus, how the Russian army used dogs as a secret weapon and a mysterious message just before the Pearl Harbor attack.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: How Russian scientists tried to create a human-ape hybrid in the 1920s. Plus, a mysterious airship crash and a disease outbreak that may have been caused by bio-weapon experiments.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: How the UFO famously sighted at Roswell may have been an experimental aircraft developed by the Nazis during the Second World War. Plus, theories about Glenn Miller's disappearance.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A US Army Air Force C47 that dropped paratroopers on D-Day is at the centre of one of the UK's most ambitious warbird rebuilds.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A team of engineers fight to return a veteran Westland Wessex helicopter to the skies - 30 years after its last flight.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: Aircraft restoration expert Mark Masters and his son James rebuild a 1943 US Army Aeronca Defender liaison plane for its German owner.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A group of amateur pilots find their light plane has a glorious war record - and launch an ambitious project to rebuild the Piper Cub and restore its military markings.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain

programme.desc: The documentary series exploring the less well known side of Britain continues, with this edition exploring MI6, asking whether the shadowy world of espionage and counter-intelligence operations bear any resemblance to the James Bond novels.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The British airmen are captured while paddling down the estuary, so Rene and the Resistance launch a cunning plan to rescue them - using a couple of coffins.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Herr Flick and Von Smallhausen prepare to meet their maker as they face a firing squad, while Madame Fanny discovers Edith in bed with the Fuehrer.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!

programme.desc: The team travels from Dublin to Derry. Mark Horton investigates a lost year in the life of the world's first ocean liner, while Neil Oliver meets the Londonderry women who secretly witnessed the surrender of German U-Boats at the end of the Second World War.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Examining the 1966 murders of three police officers in Shepherd's Bush that led to a huge manhunt and calls for the death penalty to be reinstated.

programme.sub-title: Kiruna to Narvik - Hitler's Arctic Railway Line
programme.desc: The Nordland Line, the longest in Norway at 453 miles. Stretching between Trondheim and Bodo, it was first built to transport the country's greatest natural resource - iron ore.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The changing landscape of the coastline from Newcastle to Hull. Neil Oliver explores the ancient coastal home of the Venerable Bede, and goes to Bridlington to learn about the 200-year struggle to design an unsinkable lifeboat. Mark Horton discovers how laser technology could predict coastal erosion, Dick Strawbridge finds out how Middlesbrough's Transporter Bridge put the city on the map, and Miranda Krestovnikoff heads to Bempton Cliffs.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the vast and diverse continent, aiming to show its landscapes and wildlife as they have never been seen before. He begins in the Kalahari desert, Africa's south-west corner, where clever meerkats are outsmarted by a wily bird's use of mimicry, a solitary rhino is seen to exhibit previously unknown sociable behaviours, terrifying insects prey on baby birds and the rarest fish in the world is filmed for the first time. In the neighbouring Namib desert, which receives almost no rain, the competition for scant resources can be fierce, as proven by a ferocious fight for supremacy between two giraffes.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Liverpool to Manchester Line - The First Modern Railway
programme.desc: The Liverpool and Manchester Railway, which revolutionised rail travel when it opened in 1830, becoming the first railway to have a signalling system among many other things.

programme.desc: Documentary explaining how a squadron of low-flying bombers freed resistance fighters from Amiens Jail during the Second World War.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough continues his exploration of the continent in east Africa, which is a haven for life and supports a higher density of large mammals than anywhere else on Earth. From dense forests to snow-capped peaks, steamy swamps to endless savannah, it's also a land of unpredictable extremes, where creatures must adapt to survive. In Tanzania, a tiny lizard risks its life to eat flies from the face of a sleepy lion. The nesting habits of the 4ft shoebill are also captured on camera - the giant bird has two chicks, but due to sibling rivalry only one will survive. On the plains of Amboseli, a baby elephant is near to death in the drought, so its mother leaves the herd to stay with her offspring until the bitter end.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.desc: Billy is feeling neglected, while Nellie has made the momentous decision to go away with Derek.

programme.desc: Jean and Lionel at last fulfil their dream and take a romantic trip to Paris - but it seems they are not alone. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When a doorkeeper at the House of Lords is murdered, Lynley and Havers believe the victim's gambling debts must have been the motive. When a clerk also dies, evidence of a wider conspiracy involving stolen papers is uncovered. The detectives locate the missing documents, but realise they are being followed and must catch the killer before someone beats them to it.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A Sudanese politician vows to go on hunger strike until the UK returns the skull of an important 19th-century ruler to his country. While searching for the article, Boyd is asked to re-open the case of an Iraqi shopkeeper murdered in front of his daughter 20 years ago. A tip-off from a Foreign Office official gives the team a lead - and as it probes further, it seems the two investigations could be connected. Trevor Eve stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Brian finds the library card of cold case victim Dr Richard Symes, leading the team to reinvestigate the death of the professor, who perished after falling from the roof of his college three years' previously. Sandra and Gerry interview Symes' widow, who believes principal Jeremy Ventham drove her husband to suicide following a conflict over teaching methods. Crime drama, starring Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam authorises DC Zain Nadir to meet Joshua Armstrong, a dealer at the top of the drugs chain - but the intervention of an armed motorcycle passenger threatens to cut short the entire investigation. Yvonne searches a storage unit hired by Honey's new husband Scott and finds a bloody glove, fuelling her suspicions that he killed his previous wife. Away from the line of duty, Phil angrily berates brother Steve for telling Kate Maltby about his daughter Madison.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A massive explosion rips through the Woolwich ferry, and Blue Watch is forced to join forces with Hallam and the Fire Boat crew to tackle the ensuing blaze. Meanwhile, the situation between Kevin and Sally comes to breaking point.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A Second World War bomb is discovered, which puts the wives at risk. Meanwhile, the clock begins to tick for Cate's unborn child.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads are bemused after they are ordered to capture a dangerous escaped panther, and wonder if they are the victims of a hoax. Meanwhile, Evans is disturbed to learn a friend may be bullying an Asian soldier.

Jac returns to the hospital and Ric advises Diane that she should take some time off to deal with her personal problems - though she's adamant that it isn't necessary.

programme.desc: Part two of two. When the boat accident victim arrives, the department becomes contaminated with radioactive material, forcing Charlie to close A&E. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Dan Casper has a humiliating run-in with three yobs and later tries to save face by telling Amber they threatened him with a knife. programme.desc: Pat is sent to prison as Grant is released. Rose comes back into Pete's life. Mandy finds Aidan in a difficult mood. Sanjay persuades his friends to play the horses.

programme.desc: A mistake by Duncan leads to the Glenbogle campsite being booked up by a group of naturists and Kilwillie reveals a secret. Meanwhile, Golly is prompted to take drastic action when Carlin the wolf escapes, and his hopes of a relationship with Irene are dashed when he sees her and Duncan in a passionate embrace.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Chris is bowled over by new nurse Beth and wastes little time trying to woo her, while Anna is annoyed that the whole village appears to know about her pregnancy, except the one person who really matters. Henry nurses a broken heart and confronts his love rival after one too many in the pub, and David's taxi-driving job takes its toll _ resulting in a horrific accident. Drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.desc: Middle-aged romantics Jean and Lionel finally decide to move in together, but fall out over incidental details - such as whose house they are going to live in. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.

programme.desc: Crabtree and John are transporting a convicted axe murderer to prison when she escapes to exact revenge on those who testified against her.

programme.desc: After being released from jail, notorious paedophile John Davies admits to the abduction and murder of a child 25 years previously. Crime drama, guest starring Adrian Schiller and Samantha Bond.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Two long-dead sexually conjoined bodies fall through the ceiling of a former bank after being disturbed by builders, and a gold ingot found at the scene suggests a connection with another cold case. When Eve links one of the corpses to the Opus Dei organisation, Boyd is warned off pursuing that particular line of investigation.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: A party of pilgrims is imprisoned within Shrewsbury Abbey on suspicion of murdering an old man whose body is discovered in a sack. Sleuthing monk Cadfael is soon on the scent of the killer, boiling the corpse down to its bones to ascertain the cause of death - and finding a tiny cross that could provide a vital clue. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi, Terrence Hardiman, Michael Culver, Julian Firth and Anthony Green.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer incurs the wrath of the local golf club by declaring their prize trophy is a fake - and almost gets Lady Jane expelled into the bargain. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane, Chris Jury and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lady Jane and Lovejoy grow closer while visiting a Gothic temple in Scotland. Eric falls head over heels in love and Tinker feels all at sea. Drama, with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: The return of an old enemy leads to a series of problems, beginning with the loss of Sharpe's hard-earned captaincy, and culminating in a race against time to rescue his lover Teresa and their baby from the beleaguered city of Badajoz before Wellesley's forces attack. Military adventure, starring Sean Bean and Pete Postlethwaite.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads inadvertently turn up at the wrong Spanish villa and go skinny-dipping in its swimming pool - much to the outrage of the property's occupants, who arrive home unexpectedly. Tim Healy, Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Bill Paterson star.

programme.desc: Two relentless tabloid reporters pursue the lads, convinced they are a pack of heavy-duty villains wanted back home for an audacious payroll robbery. Comedy drama, starring Christopher Fairbank and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to cure a patchy lawn at a select language school hiding dark secrets. The disappearance of a Polish student alerts them to a tale of passion, rivalry and revenge, and when a handyman is found with his throat cut they race to find the killer. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary investigate the mysterious death of a blind professor caught up in a bitter battle to save his beloved allotment from an unscrupulous land developer. A heady blend of weedkiller, cannabis and high finance hangs in the air as the duo search for clues - and another body is turned up before they track down the villain. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary and Laura are employed to restore a country churchyard in time for a medieval fair, but it is not long before a local landowner is killed by an arrow beneath an ancient yew in the centre of the graveyard. The duo investigate the possibility that rival bidders for the victim's highly desirable farm are to blame - though affairs of the heart might offer a more likely motive. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Kristin, Breen and Gina witness a fatal skydiving accident while celebrating Mike's birthday with a picnic. To make matters worse, Kristin knows the victim - entrepreneur Andre Barrington, an ex-boyfriend. When the cords are found severed, it becomes clear that his demise was either suicide or murder.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch's distressing childhood memories are evoked while investigating the death of an orphan under the care of the same Jesuit priest who taught him.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: The team members set out to prevent a gangster's firearms deal, an act which Alex believes will prevent her being shot in 2008. To obtain evidence, they have to bring the suspect's boyfriend on side, taking him to a gay club where he can see his lover is not the man he thinks he is. Ray is forced to use all his macho charm to seduce the villain in front of witnesses. Drama starring Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene questions an old adversary about a robbery, and when it is revealed the crook has had to give up his life of crime, the detective worries that he too might be past his best. However, an interview with a murder suspect puts Alex in mortal danger - and leaves Gene drawing on his experience in an attempt to save her. Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes star.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister defends a British ambassador's daughter accused of murdering an Austrian journalist, and learns a harsh lesson in the realities of political and diplomatic power. Foxcott is singed by an old flame, while Matt risks his father's anger by moving into a squat. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Lena Headey, Michael Feast and Oliver Ford Davies.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Part one of two. A massive police search leads to the body of a missing five-year-old, the victim of sexual assault and strangulation. All the evidence points to a local drunkard being the guilty party _ but as the case goes to trial it becomes clear that the outcome is by no means assured. Gripping crime drama by Lynda La Plante, starring David Hayman, Kate Buffery, Helen McCrory and Rhys Ifans.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward explores the historic city of Warwick as part of her National Gardens Scheme tour, discovering medieval buildings and the gardens of Lord Leycester Hospital.

programme.title: The Bill

programme.desc: Feature-length melodrama set in 1913, about the romantic relationship between Agnes Conway, whose parents own a sweetshop, and Charles Farrier, son of an altogether grander family. Agnes faces an added dilemma when she finds her heart divided between Charles and his soldier brother Reginald. Starring Claire Skinner and Edward Atterton.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: The rural idyll of eight-year-old David Copperfield is brought to an abrupt end when his widowed mother Clara remarries. Young David takes an instant dislike to Mr Murdstone, his new step-father, and the newcomer proves the feeling is more than mutual when he send the lad away to a boarding school run by a ruthless headmaster. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith and Ian McKellen, with a young Daniel Radcliffe starring in the title role.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: David is sent to a workhouse by his evil stepfather following his mother's death. But he finds an unlikely ally in the eternally optimistic gambler Mr Micawber. Ciaran McMenamin, Bob Hoskins, Trevor Eve and Maggie Smith star in the second part of the Dickens tale.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: Now an ambitious young man making a name for himself in London, David returns to Suffolk with his schoolfriend Steerpike in tow to catch up with Peggoty, his late mother's maid. Adaptation of the Dickens classic, starring Pauline Quirke and Ciaran McMenamin.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: Micawber threatens to expose Uriah Heep for the devious character that he is, and David returns to Canterbury once again. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Bob Hoskins.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A rare disease spreads around Poplar Street, and Patsy and Dr Turner try to trace the outbreak to its source. Suspicion over the identity of the first carrier threatens to divide a previously close-knit family. Sister Winifred is forced to confront her prejudices while treating a patient, and Barbara worries about how Trixie will react when she agrees to go to dinner with Tom.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne is seconded to a maternity ward, and is impressed by how modern technology is being used to help the mothers - but is left with a moral dilemma after assisting on a traumatic birth. A young man from Poplar is delighted to be accepted into university, but his mother is less than happy. His dreams are jeopardised when his girlfriend gets pregnant, a development that puts pressure on the whole family.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A campaigner against domestic violence is murdered and the prime suspect is an apparently reformed man whose violent behaviour once drove his ex-wife to almost kill him in self defence. programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A Polish man is killed on the building site where he worked and soon afterwards a female hotel receptionist is murdered in strikingly similar circumstances. Meanwhile, Ross puts his career on the line by spending the night with a woman involved in the case. Blythe Duff and John Michie star.

Julie Graham guest stars, with Ken Stott and Claire Price.

programme.desc: DI Morell investigates Honey's apparent abduction by new husband Scott, little suspecting she has fled with him of her own volition and is preparing to set sail for France. programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna attacks a faith healer's controversial methods, especially when a youngster with arthritis refuses conventional treatment, and Simon comes under increasing pressure from a hotshot Canadian businessman who makes a shocking takeover bid for his company. programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Butcher celebrates his forthcoming wedding to Stacey with a riotous stag party in France, but finds Continental hospitality losing its allure after a transport strike strands him on the wrong side of the Channel. While Steve Evans pulls out all the stops to get his friend to the church on time, Dr Sarah Eastwood faces an agonising romantic dilemma and Chris comes to a momentous decision.

programme.desc: DI Morell investigates Honey's apparent abduction by new husband Scott, little suspecting she has fled with him of her own volition and is preparing to set sail for France. programme.desc: Honey is interviewed by Adam and fights to save her career, insisting she was abducted by new husband Scott. programme.desc: Adrian's mooning over a new love, Joey's mooning over an old one and Jack's completely besotted with Leonora.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The new boss makes his presence felt in the holiday camp with a spate of sackings. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel moves in with Jean, but each has trouble letting go of their independence. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo shocks everyone by making an effort to dress smartly in an attempt to woo a lady. Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Jo is shocked when a single mother, fighting a lawsuit against the mobile phone company she blames for her incurable cancer, asks her to take care of her son after she dies. Presiding in the case, Deed finds himself at the centre of a plot between the phone company and Sir Ian Rochester, both of whom are eager to have him out of the way.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: An unknown tagger begins to paint graffiti around London, and claims to have been responsible for killing a celebrated street artist four years previously. Originally part of a gang, the victim went solo after receiving support from a wealthy art patron, and when the detectives reopen the case, they become suspicious of his resentful former crew members. Meanwhile, Brian signs up to a social networking site as TopCop999 to chart the gritty life of a lawman, much to his colleagues' displeasure.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team investigates after a man convicted of murdering his parents escapes from a psychiatric unit and reveals the location of a decomposed corpse. The remains are identified as those of a student who went missing in the 1960s, and a link is made between the two crimes. However, time is of the essence in tracking down their suspect when an elderly psychiatrist is taken captive.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Honey is interviewed by Adam and fights to save her career, insisting she was abducted by new husband Scott. JT begins to suspect Gina has cancer, and Dan alleges Amber has been blackmailing him to do menial duties on her behalf, while Yvonne is devastated to learn Lee Thomas, the young thug she forcibly restrained at the cemetery, has died of his injuries.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The propane cylinder storage depot blaze continues, leaving Jaffa badly burned and plunging George into agonies of guilt. Nick clashes with Skase over how to handle the emergency, and later learns to his dismay that Ariadne has gone missing, while on a quieter note, Recall and Laura enjoy a break from the children. Andrew Kazamia, Glen Murphy, and Richard Walsh star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tests the contestants' knife skills, tasking them to slice savoy cabbage. He then gives them 10 minutes to extract a whole lobster from its shell using a variety of implements and immaculately present it whole. The final task is to create an impressive lobster dish. Once the challenges are over, the three best finalists press on for the coveted title and cash prize. Presented by Fern Britton.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rhona gets a windfall from Graham's will and goes into business with Moira, Cain tells Will to choose between him and Malone, and Al and Priya kiss.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Alya tackles Geoff about his lies, David flees from a group of muggers and Ken demands a copy of the Stillwaters rulebook from Charles.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: Despite Kate being sued after an accident in the cafe, she refuses to back down and Koji is reluctant to get involved. Although Medium is convinced she should just apologise and get it over with, Kate suspects the legal threats may have something to do with Councillor Bone. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn and Jimmy Akingbola.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian follows the work of Battersea Dogs & Cats Home in London, meeting staff involved in treating, training and rehoming animals. In the first episode, Paul meets seven staffie puppies whose mother has rejected them, before he visits a 13-year-old mongrel who was found wandering the streets of North London. Elsewhere, Paul lends a hand building a ladder and a platform for nine-year-old Archie.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Maggie is in need of some time alone so she heads to the pub to see if she can get a room for the night, where she learns the real story of landlord Brian. When she finds out there are no rooms free for her to stay, Maggie decides to go and stay with daughter-in-law Becka, and the pair have a rare moment of bonding. Meanwhile, Peter is working late at the school when his secretary Karen reveals her feelings towards him in a very unexpected way. Later, Alex desperately tries to find the 'lottery' winnings' to pay off the lenders.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Robbie Lyle - Football Fans Under Their Skin
programme.desc: Arsenal fan Robbie Lyle looks at racism directed at football supporters, revealing how he has been abused andmeeting others speaking out for the first time about their experiences of racism in football - bothin the past and today.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Ellie and Hardy bring a new suspect in for questioning and in a search of this suspect's premises, Ellie finds devastating new evidence linking him to the crime. Back at the station, he gives them his detailed version of events, but when they dig deeper they begin to doubt his story, while DC Katie Harford confronts Ellie and Hardy with an uncomfortable truth about her role in the investigation. The fact that Ian has taken a personal item of Trish's without her knowledge comes to light.

programme.sub-title: The Martin Lewis Money Show - A Coronavirus Special
programme.desc: The financial journalist presents money-saving tips to help consumers cope with the current economic climate, offering expert advice on everything from premium bonds, student loans and tax credits to supermarket loyalty schemes and high-street shopping.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Trump and the Virus: America in Crisis - Tonight
programme.desc: How seriously could the coronavirus pandemic damage President's Trump's chances of re-election later this year? As the United States grapples with a full-blown health crisis, ITV's Washington Correspondent Robert Moore asks whether his controversial leadership style has properly addressed or even exacerbated the challenge ahead.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: Having previously toured their own countries, Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix now hit the highways of of the States - although in the first episode, they are in Mexico, on a mission to taste the world's best breakfast. Along the way, the trio take part in a chili-eating competition, have a beach buggy race and watch some traditional Mexican wrestling - but it isn't long before they are persuaded not take part.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. This time, Security Officer Estefania investigates an oddly shaped object, and Passenger Experience Manager Harry deals with a medical emergency. Elsewhere, Border Force Bob helps a circus performer with visa troubles.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Andrew is pushed to the edge and as he runs out of options, he concocts a plan to take drastic measures. But first, he will need help. In the present day, a vital piece of evidence comes to light and Laura seeks to discover its origin. Now in a desperate position, she must use all her wits to get the information she needs, but with Katy and Liam's assistance, she is led to a startling new suspect. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd, with Zoe Tapper, Richie Campbell and Katherine Kelly.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: Anne and James are at loggerheads following the revelations at the Brockenhursts' party. With Oliver fixated on discovering the origins of his father's new protege, Susan uses the opportunity to plan a covert trip to meet with a new friend, and enlists her maid Speer to keep the true nature of the rendezvous under wraps. Meanwhile, Lady Templemore begins work on her lavish plans for her daughter's wedding, but much to her disappointment, Lady Maria seems fixated on someone other than her fiance.

programme.desc: Billy and Cain are stunned to discover that Will has stolen the 4x4 they were holding against Malone, and Cain makes it clear that Will has now signed his own death warrant. Al and Priya kiss again, but Jai interrupts, while Wendy encourages Bob to come up with his own idea for getting Luke and Victoria back together.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Yasmeen confronts Geoff with the contents of his emails, Gemma tries to be positive as Aled's hearing aid is fitted and David apologises for using Alina.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of social worker Jenny Lister, but figuring out the motive behind the killing of an apparently popular woman proves difficult. However, an infamous past case involving the death of a child appears to hold the key. In her pursuit of the truth, Vera uncovers the failings of an understaffed care system and discovers the secret at the heart of Jenny's death - which the killer will stop at nothing to protect. Drama based on the book by Ann Cleeves, starring Brenda Blethyn and David Leon.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: The former tabloid editor interviews Alan Sugar about his career and personal life. The Apprentice star discusses his financial and legal troubles, and the nervous breakdown he experienced while fighting a libel case. He also looks back on his teenage years, his controversial tenure as chairman of Tottenham Hotspur, and the untold story behind his company's satellite dishes.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's tour of Corsica brings him to the island of Bonifacio, where he learns about its history and culture from tour guide Christine, before whipping up some cheesy stuffed aubergines. He also visits a honey producer, joins a local chef to cook with bovine bread and meets an olive oil-maker, using his some for his fish stew with garlic mayonnaise.

programme.title: Casper (1995)
programme.desc: A paranormal expert moves into a haunted house where his daughter befriends the amiable ghost of a young boy - but things start to go awry when three smelly spooks and two dastardly crooks try to chase the new residents away. Family comedy, starring Christina Ricci, Bill Pullman, Eric Idle, Cathy Moriarty and featuring the voice of Malachi Pearson.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four celebrity contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Emmerdale's Michael Parr (Ross Barton), England footballer Alex Scott, Hollyoaks actress Jennifer Metcalfe (Mercedes McQueen) and TV presenter Bill Turnbull must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show, featuring undercover pranks, surprises galore, star guests and a chance for a member of the audience to win the items advertised in one of last week's commercial breaks. Following the coronavirus outbreak, the planned series finale at Walt Disney World in Florida has been cancelled. However, the Geordie pair will surely have something up their sleeves to put a smile on the faces of the viewing public.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from locations around the UK, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol, to 1000 in the big finale game. This week, Stephen is in Bristol.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.sub-title: The Voice UK: Most Memorable Moments
programme.desc: Will.i.am introduces some of the highlights of the past four series, recalling some of the performances in the Blind Auditions that got the coaches' chairs in a spin, as well as memorable moments from the Battle and Knockout rounds.

programme.title: Inception (2010)
programme.desc: A talented thief uses hi-tech devices to enter other people's dreams so he can steal their secrets. An industrialist hires him to perform a far more challenging job - to implant an idea into a corporate heir's mind, so he will think it is his own. However, the mission is compromised by the thief's own troubled psyche. Christopher Nolan's sci-fi thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Ellen Page, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Tom Hardy.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of 10 giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to 10,000

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technologies and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare is to drive a tank blindfolded. Can he get across the course and knock down the cardboard box wall?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz has dressed Weasel up as a supervillain in order to pretend to save the city. Magoo mistakes his disguised neighbour for an actress in danger..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Weasel accidentally launches Fizz next to Magoo. The latter, believing he is driving through a wildlife reserve, mistakes Fizz for a lost child..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's underwater scooting and has discovered Atlantis. In fact, he's in New York, riding Fizz's latest invention..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean enters Scrapper into a beauty contest so that he can win First Prize: a trip with Irma to Paris..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben, Gwen, and Grandpa Max arrive at a Native American national park to witness the Ayasha Plinths.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Frenzied Farts of Flabby Flabulous
programme.desc: An accident with Mr Meaner and Melvin's new machine turns the angry teacher into a super-villain..

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Cookery show with John Torode and Lisa Faulkner, featuring recipes, shortcuts, inspiration and tips. The menu on this episode includes one pan spicy roast lamb and pear tarte tatin. Plus, The Great British Bake Off's John Whaite showcases his lemon drizzle cake and food writer Ching He Huang prepares teriyaki salmon.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott hops across to the Italian island of Sardinia, where his first stop is the beachside Ristorante La Spigola for a taste of chef Roberto's modern take on Italian dining. He also gets immersed in a classic Sardinian culinary experience, cooking suckling pig over an open fire, has a masterclass in making the local pasta Jiusoni and learns about another island speciality, casizolu cheese.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Documentary about the people who live and work in one of west Wales' most famous and historic communities - the city of St Davids in Pembrokeshire, which has fewer than 2,000 residents. An aeroplane pilot is forced to make an emergency landing on Whitesands beach, while the National Trust wardens try to round up some wild ponies. The men and women go head to head at the Penknife Club fishing competition.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The presenter heads to Loch Lomond, a freshwater Scottish loch famously celebrated in song that crosses the Highland Boundary Fault and is the largest inland stretch of water in Great Britain by surface area. Taking in the popular West Highland way, it's just a quick boat ride to the idyllic island of Inchailloch, a jewel in the loch's crown, where stunning views over the immense mass of water can be enjoyed.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.sub-title: The Voice UK: Most Memorable Moments
programme.desc: Will.i.am introduces some of the highlights of the past four series, recalling some of the performances in the Blind Auditions that got the coaches' chairs in a spin, as well as memorable moments from the Battle and Knockout rounds.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show, featuring undercover pranks, surprises galore, star guests and a chance for a member of the audience to win the items advertised in one of last week's commercial breaks.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A land dispute escalates during a cowboy fair run by the Wild West Society in the village of Ford Florey. Farmers Jack Fincher and Silas Burbage both claim to own a patch of wasteland known as the Swamp, but Dan Malko wants to buy it and create a travellers' site. Barnaby and Jones are called in when the feud leads to murder during the Wild West-style shoot-outs at the annual event. Guest starring Kenneth Cranham, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five family members answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Strictly judge Bruno Tonioli, TV doctor Zoe Williams and former Corrie actress Catherine Tyldesley to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents the special edition of the game show in which four relatives team up - this week the Walmsleys from Leyland - and pit their wits against one of the finest quiz brains in the country, in the hope of taking away thousands of pounds.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: As AJ returns to the hospital keen to impress, Aisha and Lydia come to blows managing Jyoti's case and Greg discovers a shocking secret that Tommy has been hiding. Ruby helps Ted track down a possible lead, while her relationship with Gabriel hits obstacles. Medical drama, starring Amanda Redman, Amrita Acharia, Neil Morrissey, Kenneth Cranham and Priyanka Bose.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: John appeals to members of the Trenchards' staff in his bid to uncover the truth about Charles, while Turton and Ellis are quick to betray their employers and prove surprisingly adept at deceit and spying. Susan makes a seemingly miraculous discovery, and begrudgingly agrees to accompany Anne and James to their country estate in the hope of extracting further information about Oliver. Stephen makes a last-ditch attempt to secure the funds he needs to pay off his debt - a deal that puts his life in danger.

programme.title: The Olivier Awards
programme.desc: Jason Manford presents the best moments from the past few moments of the theatrical awards, with a line-up of star-studded cast of award-winners and presenters taking to the stage to celebrate the best in live theatre. Including performances by the casts of The Lion King, Mamma Mia!, The Book of Mormon, Hamilton, Dreamgirls, Come from Away and Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat.

programme.title: Secrets of the Driving Test
programme.desc: An insight into the world of the driving test, filmed over a two-year period and offering unprecedented access to the Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency (DVSA), with cameras fitted inside and outside of the test car. In the first episode, examiner Wayne has the task of taking 27-year-old Shaunna from Hull through the driving test, which will be her 12th attempt at passing. In Cardiff, Drew is desperate to pass, if only to stop the arguments with his partner Karl, who's been teaching him to drive. Narrated by Alan Carr.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Maggie is in need of some time alone so she heads to the pub to see if she can get a room for the night, where she learns the real story of landlord Brian. When she finds out there are no rooms free for her to stay, Maggie decides to go and stay with daughter-in-law Becka, and the pair have a rare moment of bonding. Meanwhile, Peter is working late at the school when his secretary Karen reveals her feelings towards him in a very unexpected way. Later, Alex desperately tries to find the 'lottery' winnings' to pay off the lenders.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Australian Wilderness with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The adventurer follows the Frankland River into the heart of the 65 million-year-old Walpole Forest - 200 square kilometres of wooded wilderness in Western Australia that provides food and shelter for Aboriginal people. Ray learns that the river was once used by loggers to transport jarrah wood, which is so hard it was used as cobbles for London streets in Victorian times. In the forest, the adventurer lies in wait for the elusive quokka, a small and shy marsupial, and meets environmentalist Prue Anderson, who shows him some of the other forest creatures that she's captured on her hidden camera.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James goes on a culinary journey around the UK, with fellow chef and friend Galton Blackiston joining him as he begins in the Isles of Scilly. The pair don diving suits to swim with seals and hire an unusual mode of transport to take them around the islands.

programme.title: Tenable

The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Forager Julia scours the shoreline for seaweed for her sustainable soaps, the bug farm hosts its summer fair and the residents of Britain's smallest city celebrate the end of the busy summer season at farmer Gerald's harvest party.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Now reunited with Katy, Laura takes drastic measures to hold the person framing her to account in a last-ditch bid for her freedom. But first, she must discover his identity and where he's hiding. To achieve what she needs to prove her innocence, she is forced to collude with the most surprising of people and the shocking truth of what happened on the morning Andrew died is finally revealed. Conclusion of Harry and Jack Williams' thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Keane & Vieira - Best of Enemies
programme.desc: The on-field rivalry between midfielders Roy Keane and Patrick Vieira during their time at Manchester United and Arsenal respectively, when they strived for dominance in a golden period for the clubs. There was no love lost between the two combative players, who captained their teams and enjoyed many memorable battles in the quest for Premier League glory. In this programme, Gabriel Clarke interviews both men.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster, including Adam Page, Chris Jericho, Cody and Jon Moxley.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: 1000 Heartbeats
programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win 25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by chef Galton Blackiston for a tour of Cornwall. They sample some world-class ice cream before visiting Newlyn fish market to buy cod, which James cooks with oysters and tartare sauce. The trip concludes with a visit to Sennen beach, where they practice their oil painting and break out the barbecue.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five members of a Surrey bowling club answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine.
